Entry.JapaneseText: <Mel>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mel>

Entry.JapaneseText: アルベルト
Entry.EnglishText: Albert

Entry.JapaneseText: <Dio>
Entry.EnglishText: <Dio>

Entry.JapaneseText: エトス
Entry.EnglishText: Ethos

Entry.JapaneseText: 好奇心旺盛の商人
Entry.EnglishText: Surprised Clerk

Entry.JapaneseText: Variable
Entry.EnglishText: Variable

Entry.JapaneseText: ここは？
Entry.EnglishText: What's this place?

Entry.JapaneseText: はっ、そったらことも知らねーだが？ ここはお店で旅に役立つもんが いろいろ揃ってるだーよ
Entry.EnglishText: Hah, you really don't know anything, do you? This is a store where you can buy a variety of wares.

Entry.JapaneseText: へん！ タンス野郎が偉そうに
Entry.EnglishText: Heh! This dresser bastard sure likes to run his tongue!
Entry.Notes: Review: Maybe something less offensive. maybe "This dumb dresser sure like sto run his mouth!"

Entry.JapaneseText: たたたた、た、たんすぅ〜〜!? ざけっでねーよ！ おらをバカにすっかもう
Entry.EnglishText: D-D-D-D-Dresser? What kind of showcase of stupidity is this!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Dio>。 アルベルトさんでしょ
Entry.EnglishText: <Dio>, his name is Mister Albert.

Entry.JapaneseText: おーおーほほ、さすがは<Mel><Mel>だ。 おらのことをよーぐわがっでる。 優しい娘っ子だなや〜
Entry.EnglishText: Ohohoho! You're amazing <Mel>-<Mel>! You certainly understand me! What a nice girl!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mel><Mel>って……
Entry.EnglishText: W-What? "<Mel>-<Mel>"...?

Entry.JapaneseText: そんな<Mel><Mel>のために、 ここはおらが買い物の仕方、 手取り足取り教えてやるだーよ
Entry.EnglishText: For <Mel>-<Mel>'s sake, I will explain the ways of shopping. I'll hold your hand or, if I need be, your leg. So, let the teaching begin!

Entry.JapaneseText: えーまんず、店の人間に ちゃんと挨拶するだ
Entry.EnglishText: First we'll start by greeting the vendor.

Entry.JapaneseText: おい、おめんとこ商品 買いに来てやったど
Entry.EnglishText: Hello! We're here to buy some wares!

Entry.JapaneseText: わ、 クローゼットが しゃべった！？
Entry.EnglishText: What the!? A talking closet!?

Entry.JapaneseText: いや……クローゼットでも お客様……
Entry.EnglishText: No...even if it's a closet it's still a customer...

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ〜♪ 道具屋『天地無用』へ ようこそ！
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome to "This side up" item store! Nice to meet you!

Entry.JapaneseText: お探しの品は何でしょうか
Entry.EnglishText: What items are you looking for?

Entry.JapaneseText: ええが？ このショップ画面に入ったら、 買いたい商品を選んで
Entry.EnglishText: Right. Once you are in the store. Select the item you want to buy.

Entry.JapaneseText: 方向キーの左右で欲しい個数を 決めるだよ。んで、<icon:40>1)で 買ってやればいいだ
複数の商品が欲しい場合は まとめて買うことも できるっちゅー話だど
Entry.EnglishText: If you want more than one item, you can buy them all at once.

Entry.JapaneseText: あー、商品買う前には、 ガルドが足りてるかどうか きーっちり確認しとくだよ
Entry.EnglishText: Uh, before you buy any items, make sure you have enough Gald.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何してんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: What're you doing?

Entry.JapaneseText: 今、買ったモノを 書いてるの
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, I'm writing down everything we bought.

Entry.JapaneseText: 買ったもの全部 そこに書くつもりか？
Entry.EnglishText: Everything we bought, you're going to write it all down there?

Entry.JapaneseText: そ。いつ、どこで、誰と、 何したか、こうして 書いとけば思いだせるでしょ
Entry.EnglishText: True but still... from now on let's remember every place and person so we don't run into this problem again.

Entry.JapaneseText: ふーん…… めんどくせーこと してんのな
Entry.EnglishText: Ugh... That sounds like a pain...

Entry.JapaneseText: メニューのライブラリを開けば、 <Mel><Mel>が書いたメモが いつでも見られるだ
Entry.EnglishText: In the Library menu you can always check the Memos that <Mel>-<Mel> writes down.

Entry.JapaneseText: これからの旅に 色々と役立つ情報ばかりだで、 こまめに確認するといいべよ
Entry.EnglishText: It's a good idea to record everything you can from now on.

Entry.JapaneseText: さ、行こうぜ。 困った人探しの続き
Entry.EnglishText: Now that that's settled, let's go help some people!
